message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.SD 

This paper is likely to belong to the sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a procedure for generating samples that are consistent with the local structure captured by a contractive auto-encoder. Additionally, the paper discusses the use of the contractive auto-encoder for improving classification error, which is a common topic in the machine learning field. 

The paper may also belong to cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it discusses the use of a stochastic process to define a distribution from which one can sample. 

Furthermore, the paper may be relevant to cs.CV (Computer Vision) as the contractive auto-encoder can be used for feature extraction and representation learning, which are important tasks in computer vision. 

The paper may also be relevant to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) as it discusses the use of a neural network architecture (the contractive auto-encoder) for learning representations of input data. 

Finally, the paper may be relevant to cs.SD (Sound) as the techniques discussed in the paper could potentially be applied to audio data, which is an area of research in the sound sub-category.
